story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Thailand, there was a kind and curious little boy named Sarayu. Sarayu's parents were poor but hardworking, and they taught him the importance of kindness, respect, and gratitude.

One day, as Sarayu was playing near the river, he saw a small, shiny object in the water. He waded in and picked it up, realizing that it was a beautiful golden coin. Sarayu was thrilled and decided to use the coin to buy his parents a special gift.

He ran to the village marketplace, searching for the perfect present. After some time, he found a small shop selling intricate, hand-carved wooden animals. Sarayu immediately thought of his parents, who both loved animals, and chose a beautiful elephant for his mother and a majestic tiger for his father.

The shopkeeper, an old, wise woman, smiled at Sarayu and said, "You have chosen well, young one. But I must tell you that these animals are magic and will only stay with you as long as you use their powers for good deeds."

Sarayu considered her words carefully and nodded, promising to use the magical animals to help those in need. With the wooden tiger and elephant securely in his bag, he hurried home.

As Sarayu presented the wooden animals to his parents, they were overjoyed, and the family spent the evening sharing stories and laughter. Sarayu tucked the golden coin away, keeping it as a reminder of the magical day.

Over time, Sarayu used the magical animals to help his fellow villagers. The tiger helped a farmer who had lost a cow, leading him straight to the animal, and the elephant assisted a young girl who had dropped her basket of fruit by gently picking it up and returning it to her.

News of Sarayu and his magical animals spread, and soon people from neighboring villages came seeking help. Sarayu, always kind and humble, was happy to oblige, assisting those in need and never asking for anything in return.

Eventually, the golden coin Sarayu had found in the river began to glow, and the wise shopkeeper appeared before him. "The magic of the golden coin has come to an end, my dear Sarayu. But do not be sad, for you have proven that kindness and compassion can create their own magic."

And indeed, Sarayu's kindness had touched the lives of so many in his village and beyond, creating a beautiful legacy that would be remembered for generations.

With that, the shopkeeper disappeared, leaving Sarayu with the memories of the magical golden coin and the countless acts of kindness that had followed.

As you drift off to sleep, my dear son, remember that you, too, have the power to create magic through kindness, compassion, and generosity. Good night and sweet dreams.
